characters: BACK ON MAK, DAVE, AND ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA LOOKS DOWN ON the village, nestled in the I valley below. Simple wood-framed houses. Smoking i chimneys. Lighted windows. The night is chilly, thick, spooky. The DOGS of the village are heard BARKING and : HOWLING, upset by something that they understand, even | if we don't. i LETTERS READ... "Salem, Massachusetts. 1692." Under a full moon a spooky-looking high-eaved little house glowers down at the village from the top of a hill. ‘Smoke rises up out of its chimney, twisting and turning in a very unnatural fashion. This is no ordinary smoke, and this is no ordinary house. The CAMERA FINDS something moving through the bushes just below the house and FOLLOWS the source of the motion. Suddenly, the shivering bushes part, and two heads appear. They belong to a pair of local farm children, THACKERY and ELIJAH BINX. Thackery, thirteen, is the older. Elijah, his brether, is ten. Both wear homespun, simple clothing. They peer up at the house, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: They conjure. Look! He points at the chimney smoke in which the shapes of little demons and beasts can be seen forming and unform- ing in the vapors. Elijah is really scared. Thackery starts crawling toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: ELIJAH
dialogues.text: Thackery! But he follows him... CAMERA FOLLOWS the two children, as they crawl through the bramble-filled yard toward the lighted windows of the spooky-looking house. They reach the window and peer in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main room of the house is lit only by the fire in the broad hearth and by candles placed in a circle around the room. ‘The CAULDRON BOILS on the fire as the three Sanderson sisters, WINIFRED, MARY, and SARAH stand around it. Very old, and dressed in the heavy black woolen clothing of the era, they look like exactly what they are... witches. Winifred is the eldest and by far the most powerful. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © Ne

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Once beautiful, her beauty has been corrupted by evil (her fingers have grown talons, her teeth have sharpened), but she is still vain, and she hates children for their youth and prettiness. Winifred has a nasty temper; when she gets really angry, her -hair stands on end, and she possesses an ability to discharge jolts of electrical energy. Winifred has great aril? with potions and spells. She is a very dangerous witch. Mary, the middle sister, is obese and gluttonous. Obsessed with food, she possesses the outward manner of a sweet as sugar kindly aunt. Mary loves little children. She loves them because she loves to eat them. Mary's sense of smell is incredibly keen; she can follow the scent of a child like a bloodhound. Sarah, the youngest, is the idiot sister. She's also beautiful and sexy. She likes to torture things: small animals, children, bugs, you name it. Any suggestion of cruelty (to somebody else) sends her into a fit of idioti cackling laughter, while any fear for herself sends her into a fit of terrified screaming. She's a mess. The children watch as Winifred reads from the recipe in her ancient spell book.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (reading) Oil of boil... (puts in a drop) And a dead man's toe... Drops one in. Suddenly, Sarah's nose catches a whiff of something. She sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I smell... (licks her lips) Children.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Thackery and Elijah duck for cover as Sarah, Winifred, and Mary step up to the window and gaze out.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Thackery and Elijah hide right below them, motionless, as Sarah sniffs and Winifred's evil eyes scan the darkness for their favorite prey... children. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a ghostly white form can be seen approaching through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Sisters, our guest is here. The witches share an evil laugh of pleasure and move back into the room. The kids are terrified, as the white form approaches and becomes identifiable as... a LITTLE GIRL dressed in a long white night shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ELIJAH
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) 'Tis our sister, Emily! The Little Girl's eyes are closed. She is walking in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) Emily... Emily! But she walks right past them and into the house.

dialogues.speaker: ELIJAH
dialogues.text: She is. bewitched!

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Run to town. Fetch the elders.

dialogues.speaker: ELIJAH
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Go, Elijah. Run like the wind. Elijah crawls away, then gets to his feet and sprints off down the hill toward the village.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN HOUSE
dialogues.text: Emily sits on a stool next to the bubbling cauldron. Winifred continues reading from her spell book.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: 'Finally when 'tis nearly done, Add a bit of thy own tongue...

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: as she bites her own tongue, then spits into the cauldron.

dialogues.speaker: CAULDRON
dialogues.text: as it bubbles up, changing to a dark sickly purple color and giving off a menacing curl of vapor. ’

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: 'Tis ready for tasting. Mary is about to take a taste, but Winifred gives her a painful backhand, knocking her away from it. She dips a . Spoon into the potion, then holds the steaming spoon ou to Emily.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: One drop of this, and her life will be mine. The witches cackle. The entranced little girl opens her mouth wide as Winifred leans in with the spoon. But suddenly the door to the house flies open, and Thackery races in.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: A boy! Thackery flings a stool at Winifred; she jumps clear, flicking the contents of the spoon on Mary, whom it SIZZLES. . Thackery grabs a long iron pot hook off the wall. He swings it at the witches, who recoil from him. Winifred snatches up her spell book and holds it protectively.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Get him, you fools!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Get him, you fool! Mary shoves Sarah at Thackery, and Thackery gives her a good bop on the head.» As Winifred, getting furious, starts gathering power for a major electrical discharge, Thackery hooks the edge of the cauldron with the pot hook and dumps it over. The BUBBLING GOO spills all over the dirt floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON WINIFRED
dialogues.text: as she shrieks in rage at the sight of her ruined potion. Her hair is now standing out straight in the air. Thackery bolts for the door, but Winifred nails him with a massive jolt of electricity and he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: FROM FLOOR
dialogues.text: CC as he comes to and sees the witches' three ugly faces Nd staring DOWN AT him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Thackery tries to struggle, but they've tied him up.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: See how bravely he struggles. They cackle.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: What shall we do with him, sisters?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Roast him with potatoes!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Put hornets in his ears!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: No no, he's such a brave little ~ boy, -his punishment must be more co ... inventive... Let's find something in my book. She pets the book.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The book! The book! Sarah and Mary cackle with glee as Winifred lovingly opens and peruses her spell book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see... Warts... Itching... Crib death --

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (gleefully)

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (smacks her) I have it! -His punishment will not be to die, but to live forever...

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: ~ (cackling) As what, Winnie? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROPS TO the floor. with their broomsticks. The door flies open. fills the house. The townspeople toss torches to pyre. ever-laughing witches.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: As what? As what? Winifred reads from the book.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Twist the bones and bend the back; Trim him of his baby fat. Give him fur, as black as black, And pointy claws with which to spat! Winifred hisses at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches are set to be hanged over a pyre. Elijah stand with their FATHER.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER BINX
dialogues.text: Confess your crimes. Where be the boy, Thackery Binx?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We are innocent!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Victims we are! Let this madness stop! No last meal?

dialogues.speaker: . FATHER BINK
dialogues.text: Silence, hag! The boy?!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Mortal ignorant fools! Hang us, burn us, what ye will! But our spirits abide here in this hill, that one Hallow'd Eve when the moon is round, a virgin will summon us from the ground! The witches poke cruelly AT CAMERA Torchlight Emily and Flames leap at the (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: We will be back! You have not seen the last of us, Salem Village! (Mother Goosey) Mind ye children well... mind ye childr -- CAMERA PANS UP TO AND HOLDS ON the full moon as the WITCHES SHRIEK WITH LAUGHTER. But their shrieking is suddenly cut short, as we hear the PLANK TUMBLE to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, something small and sad watches from the bushes. Watery marble eyes blink slowly. When they open, they're looking up at...

dialogues.text: Among. the students in the classroom are ALLISON WILLIAMSON (15, prettiest girl in town) and BEN and ALAN (14, town's geeky outcasts). A witch-like face:

dialogues.speaker: MISS OLIN
dialogues.text: Could anyone explain for us how the cultural significance of Halloween and our own local history might perhaps share some common ground? A tarantula secretly crawls among the feet of the students. It crawls towards Allison's feet. Ben knows about it, so Alan diverts the class.

dialogues.speaker: MISS OLIN
dialogues.text: Yes... Mr. Schotznick?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Halloween, or more properly, Allhallows Eve, in medieval times was a holy evening. It took place on October 3lst, the eve of All Saints Day when the souls of the dead rose and walked the Earth again. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which is exactly what Salem's own most diabolical ancestors vowed to do on this very night. (beat) The Sanderson sisters, before being hanged by a town full of most righteous and, if you ask me, most improperly dumped- on witch hunters, swore they'd come back to avenge themselves on Salem's children... that would be us. (beat) There are those to this day, Mr. Corwin. and myself included, who believe that every Halloween night a black cat still guards the old Sanderson house, warning off any who might bring the witches back from the grave.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh! The tarantula's on Allison's foot. She flips it away. It lands..on its back -- legs wrigglin' -- exposing its electronic innards. The BELL RINGS. The class exits. ' Allison glares at Ben. He shrugs, points to Max. She looks at him. He smiles, gratefully. But, shaking her head, she leaves. Max's crest falls.

dialogues.text: Ben and Alan's lockers are altars to superstitious protectives. Max collects his stuff from his locker nearby. He can't stop looking at Allison down the hall. Ben consults his."locker-rolodex."

dialogues.text: Williamson, Allison. 15. Birthdate June 20, 1976. Freshman. 'A' student. Took over finest babe throne from Christi Klipenger upon arrival. Family assets exceed 7 digits. Lives 397 Chestnut Street. Social calendar full to the 12th of never.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN

dialogues.text: Max rides out of the mall under an anvil of teenage angst, looking back at Allison getting into her mom's car. Wham! He runs into JAY and ERNIE (17, town jerks emeritus -- an Axl Rose apostle and a white rap fanatic), on their moto-cross bikes. Their bags of Halloween prank supplies scatter.

dialogues.speaker: . ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ski resort that's a mountain bike park in the off- season. Max rides by an old cemetery and up to the ticket booth with purpose. He takes the ski lift. EXT. MOUNTAIN TOP - "SUICIDE GORGE” - DAY Max suits up: helmet, gloves, pads. Rides to the edge of the expert run -- vertical deathtrap; rocks, moguls... Max breathes deep. Cinches down his toe straps. Death- grip on bars. Is just about to pedal over the edge, when... ... he chokes. Frustrated, he backs away from the edge just as Ernie and Jay fly by him -- jetting down the run. Their bikes are agile horses. Max rides off, at once scared and disappointed.

dialogues.text: Dani just

dialogues.speaker: CANDLE
dialogues.text: as Max's lighter ignites the flame, but instead of giving off light, the flame literally sucks in the light around it, like a black hole.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX'S REACTION
dialogues.text: as he realizes he's just made the blunder of his life.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. But it's too late. With a sudden IMPLOSION/EXPLOSION, all the light in the room is sucked into the candle, while at the same time a strange HOWLING WIND emanates out of the flame and blows around the room. Hellish LAUGHTER and SCREAMING are heard as the WIND GUSTS, blowing around dust and objects...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light erupts from the ground, carrying the buried ashes of the witches in streams up through the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light 'n' ashes stream up into the wax dummies -- lighting them from the inside out. Melting the wax...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: No no no... The EFFIGIES MOAN like the undead. Wax drops off them in luminous. thick lugies. The PLASTER EXPLODES from the mannequins! Waxy plaster dust fills the room. Moonlight filtered in the trillion particles clears slowly. The | kids duck behind the spellbook display. They stare and shudder at what has impossibly manifest before them:

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON SISTERS
dialogues.text: skinny, fat and ugly. Unchanged and pissed. They are slow to realize their good fortune. As they pinch themselves to verify their freshliness: ‘ WINIFRED Sisters, we have returned! They howl and cackle with delight.

dialogues.speaker: MAX AND ALLISON
dialogues.text: in hiding --

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: . (sotto voce) What happened?

dialogues.text: A virgin lit the candle. Max is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: But who brought us back? The witches scan the room and see the three witch effigies. Winifred approaches them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘oe

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Sisters? She puts her hand on one, and it falls over. Winifred examines them, puzzled. Suddenly, Sarah's nose starts twitching.

dialogues.text: Do you not smell them, sisters?

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (licks her lips) Children.

dialogues.text: Let's pluck their eyes out! Winifred whacks Mary with the back of her hand, sending her slamming into a rack of potions. Winifred turns on the charm.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Come. out, my dears. We will not harm you.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We love children. Winifred suddenly flips over the table, revealing Dani, who is petrified. Dressed as a witch, she thinks fast and pretends to be one.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Greetings, sisters.

dialogues.speaker: , WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Greetings, little one.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: It was I who brought you back.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (not buying it) I see. The three witches gather closely around her, pawing and poking her with their sharp fingers.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (menacingly) Such a pretty little girl. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: —, Pretty fingers. Pretty eyeballs.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (squeezing her arm for plumpness) And she's so well fed.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Tell me, my sweet, what is the date?

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: (terrified) Octo -- to -- tober 31.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Allhallow Eve. My curse worked > just as planned. And the year?

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Sisters, we have been dead... three oO hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: How time flies...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: When you're dead! The witches howl with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: DANT
dialogues.text: Guess I'll be going.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (blocking her way) Stay for supper.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But _we are! The witches howl with evil laughter and seize Dani with their talon-like hands. They are about to tear her to pieces when a voice shouts... oe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The witches turn and see... Max, holding one of the buckets of rainwater. He hurls the water, scoring a direct hit on Winifred, and soaking her thoroughly... Everything stops, as everyone looks at Winifred to see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: as she gets so mad that the WATER literally SIZZLES off her face.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) It .worked in Ihe Wizard Of Oz. Back to Winifred as her rage increases; her electricity charges up, her hair stands straight on end. Suddenly, she throws out her hands and zaps Max with a stream of CRACKLING ELECTRICAL ENERGY. Mary and Sarah cackle with delight as Max is literally lifted off the ground, writhing in the electrical field.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Burn him to a cinder!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Roast him, Winnie! Now Dani gets mad.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: You_leave my brother alone! She picks up a small pot and beans Winifred with it. The electrical charge is broken, Max slumps to the ground, and Winifred goes down to the floor, momentarily stunned, but in an instant she. has regained her’ senses. She snatches up Dani with both hands and lifts her off the ground... When Allison attacks her, but Winifred easily knocks her aside with a blow from her hand. Winifred is about to wring Dani's neck... When suddenly, there is a ferocious YOWL, and the black CAT leaps out from its hiding place high on a shelf and lands on Winifred's head, scratching and clawing her savagely. Winifred releases Dani, and all hell breaks loose... ‘ (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mary tries to grab Allison, who punches her in the nose.. Winifred tears the cat off her and throws it against the wall. Max comes to his senses, sees what's happening, then spots the sprinkler system on the ceiling... Mary cackles like an idiot...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Here, kitty kitty kitty! Dani finds her candy bag. Winifred is about to grab her again, when Max suddenly leaps up on the table.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey! He clicks the lighter, which flames. That catches the witches' attention.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You have messed with the Great and Powerful Max, and must now suffer the consequences! I summon... the Burning Rain of Death! Max (who has positioned himself perfectly) lifts his hand and holds the flame. under an old sprinkler head on the ceiling. For a beat nothing happens, and then an old FIRE ALARM BELL starts SOUNDING and all the SPRINKLER HEADS on the ceiling start gushing water. The witches scream in horror, as they imagine they are about to die an agonizing death.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The Burning Rain of Death! Screams. While the kids scramble to escape, the black cat, who is of course Thackery Binx, leaps up onto Max's shoulder, putting his face right up to Max's. Three hundred years have turned Binx into a tough, very worldly cat.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Get the spellbook. Max instinctively reaches to pry the cat off -- Binx bites his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Oh, God, you talk! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: I do lots of other things, too. You listen to me, boy, get that book or there'll be hell to pay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is paralyzed. Whap! Whap! -- couple quick paw- shots ‘cross Max's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! MK Max grabs the spellbook. He runs out past the writhing witches. Binx scrambles after them.

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: Hey! Heel! Heel!

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: Follow me. Max stops. Allison and Dani stop. Look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: ., MAX
dialogues.text: a) Wait a minute! I wanna know what's goin’ on?! Binx turns ‘round and leaps back up in Max's face again.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Stop doin' that! Binx stuffs a paw in Max's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Shut up. I'ma cat. I'm talking | to you. You understand what I'm | saying. Some 300-year-old witches ! wanna kill you. Anymore questions? Good. More later. Right now, who's in charge?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Woo war.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: (pats Max's forehead) Fine boy. This way. C \ Binx dashes away. Dani follows. Allison next. She — leaves Max with a sudden disapproving look,

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON HOUSE
dialogues.text: The witches, still screaming in imagined agony, are getting soaked.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: as she tastes the water streaming into her mouth and realizes...

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Water! It is but water! Sarah and Mary stop screaming and lap up the droplets.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Most refreshing.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (smacks her) The boy has tricked us! (sees broken case) My book! They have stolen it! After them, sisters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++ lead down the hill by Mary's "life-of-its-own" nose -- like Toucan Sam to the Fruit Loops. They stop suddenly at a black river.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The river styx?... Winnie, have we truly gone to --

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: -- What is that? They: view a beat-up sedan nearby.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: 'Tis is most strange vessel... (emblem) Ah... a vessel for Fording this river.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So clever, sister. Mayhaps ‘tis not too deep... Winifred shoves Sarah on to asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sister, I can't swim! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sarah stumbles onto the road and stands there drowning in oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: 'Tis firm as stone! It is a road.

dialogues.speaker: MARY/ SARAH
dialogues.text: (a goofy jig) Just like bone, 'tis firm as stone! A little road, let's kick a toad! WONK! Huge headlights cut out of the darkness. They barrel straight for Sarah and Mary. The witches scream:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Dragon! They leap for the bushes and hide there watching as a FIRETRUCK speeds by, SIRENS BLARING. It stops at the Sanderson house.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Witch-hunters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Binx leads the way -- Dani, Allison and Max hurry after him. They approach the gates of the "Salem County Cemetery."

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: This is a graveyard!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Brilliant, someone told you?

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Why're you talkin' us in here?

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Just do what he says, Max!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Really. You got us into this anyway!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Me?! You're the one that wanted to go up there --

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: -- I didn't light the candle -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Kids, kids, knock that stuff off or Tl turn this car around right now: Binx squeezes through the iron gates. The gang follows.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Step lively, ‘tis hallowed ground, the vile witches cannot set foot upon it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIREMEN kill the sprinklers and head for the truck.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Kids again.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Man, I hate Halloween. The FIRETRUCK RUMBLES away. As the witches emerge from the bushes:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The crimson vessel of witch hunters, sisters. Did ye see the tools of torture? (lites, tires, hoses, axes) A witch is blinded first, then crushed ‘neath the rollers, hanged by the nooses and tortured with the axe of confession!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, ‘tis a different world. Hurry, we must get back the book. Mary snatches a burly wood-beetle off the house. She eats it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (munching) What book, sister?

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: My spellbook!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why, sister? Pray, tell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need it to perform a spell!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What spell, sister?

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (crowns them) Sisters, consider thy arms. They do. Winifred digs a finger into hers. She gets wax. Sarah gets wax. Mary hurts herself.

dialogues.speaker: . MARY
dialogues.text: Ouh! Are we not flesh, sister?!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: 'Tis only thy girth which slows they fate.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (blubbering) But I don't want to be a dummy, Winnie!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Little help for that, sister. (hypothesis) I fear the hourglass is pouring. See too how we move about now? We do not walk as flesh, we float as spirit, neither alive nor dead. We must get the spellbook and conjure for our lives this night! Come, the hours are numbered... Winifred spins grandly -- her witch-togs twirling -- heads for the house. The dunces follow:

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: ++. and we are dead by dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids follow Binx through the graveyard. Past tombstones. A skeleton wielding a scythe appears from nowhere, they scream. Just a sculpted gravemarker. Binx leaps atop it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: William Butcher. Murderer. Thief. Drunkard. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: d

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: A versatile guy, he was, Billy the Butcher.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh right, like you knew him.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: "Like totally’ I knew him. That's right, junior, I did. I knew Napoleon B., Mark Twain, Tom Edison, Davy Crockett, Chuck Lindbergh, Babe Ruth and Walt Disney, too.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Really?...

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Really. I knew Billy before and after he was strung up... The witches stole his body from the gallows and brought him back to life to raise a little hell, if ya know.what I mean. To keep their secrets, they cut out his tongue and sewed his mouth shut with a dull needle. The kids react -- hands to lips. Stark silence.

dialogues.speaker: BINX \
dialogues.text: Now you know what we're dealing with. It ain't Elizabeth Montgomery. There, now, since I've got your attention, boys and girls, let me just say that we are in one 'grave' situation. Sorry, couldn't help myself.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Are you the little boy who was turned into a cat.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Yes. I am. Thackery Binx, at your service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is wrecked. Winifred whistles -- a classic twig broom flies to her. Sarah whistles -- a modern- type nylon-bristle angle broom skitters over to her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (NOTE: When she flies then, her broom is always out of alignment -- she flies at an "angle.") Mary whistles -- a 30-year-old chrome-railed Electrolux vacuum chugs out of the closet to her, and... ++. unceremoniously slaps her in the forehead with its chrome handle. With an impressive flurry of cape, Winifred mounts her broom.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: To_the sky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches fly across the full moon. They consider Salem Village far below. The city lights seem like pyres.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Salem Village is a change'd world. Many witches burning regular now.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT GRAVEYARD
dialogues.text: Dani and Allison listen intently as Binx tells his tale. Max is still feeling peeved.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Do you like being a cat a lot?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: At first I enjoyed myself. Being a cat was a highly sensuous experience. I slept all day, prowled around at night... My family took me in; I slept by the fire, and everybody petted me. But then... the years started to pass. I watched my parents grow old and die, and my brothers and sisters... And their children, and their children. But I was always left behind. The kids are stunned and saddened.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Why didn't you kill yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Don't you think I tried? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: NA But I always survived. I feel into deep despair. I couldn't die, but I had no reason to live. Then one day I realized... Immortality was a curse, but it gave me a purpose... The Sanderson sisters had vowed to return from the grave, but I'd always be here to stop them. They'd never harm another child, as long as I was here. So for three centuries I've guarded that house, especially on Halloween night... (pointedly at Max) | When I knew some airhead virgin might light that candle.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Make sure the hags don't get the spellbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OO This?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Yes, that. The devil's spellbook. It contains all of witch Winifred's most powerful and heinous spells. (to Max) Don't let it out of your sight, and remember this, all of you, it is evil and only evil can come of it. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: | Good. :

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: They did magic at their house, how come they need it?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Good point. As near as I can figure, they have minor magic ~ at their beck and call. Ya know, unseen force, fireballs from the palms, bewitchments, cetra cetra.

dialogues.speaker: CO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: If they get it back, what would they do with it?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: I only saw them conjure with it once. They'd cooked a potion that, as near as I could ever figure out, they planned to give to the children of Salem Village. For what?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Well, we're just talking about three old ladies versus the 20th century, right? I mean, how bad could it be? Suddenly, an electric cord drops, dangles from the sky in front of Max. Binx looks skyward:

dialogues.speaker: BIN
dialogues.text: Bad.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Book be mine! The spellbook leaps!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Get it! Max intercepts... Allison and Dani take cover -- hide “their eyes. Binx leaps to the tombstone.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: This is hallowed ground. Whisk off, wretched hags!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Thackery Binx? My, my, still alive?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Till the end of eternity if it means vexing the likes of you, vile wench!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Enjoying your 9 millions lives? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: That strikes a cord in Binx. He's a taut ball of fur.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Catch the kitty. Bind him with wire. Skin him alive. Set him afire!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Children, give us the book, and we'll be gone.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: No way, fatso!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (evil) Fatter still when I'm through with you! Mary dive-bombs Dani. She flattens to the ground. The Electrolux zooms inches above.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Enough! Give me the book or die!

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: Land here and take it, evil sow. Winifred and her sister "air-huddle."

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: I don't like this.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: But you said they can't touch us here, right?... Right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘They’ cannot.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Whadda you mean 'they'? Winifred unpockets the black flame candle. Holds it ready:

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Souls at peace, remain at rest; Tortured spirit, join our quest. Smell with nose, see with eye; Twist your fingers toward the sky; Push aside your earthen sheet; Stand upon your good dead feet. Life is sweet; be not shy-sleeping slave, arise! Arise! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Winifred snaps her craggy fingers and lights the candle. Binx is thrown off William Butcher's tombstone -- the gravemarker rolls. Rotted coffin planks erupt from the grave. Then... - BILLY THE BUTCHER climbs out. A zombie. His mouth sewn shut. He blinks the dirt from his eyes -- which are somehow miraculously intact. Nothing else about him is though. Dani, Allison and Max are struck dumb and frozen stiff. Binx leaps onto Max's chest once more.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Hey! (slap-slap) Ever see i Dead? {as Max nods) Well, it's all true. Zombies eat people. We're gone like the wind. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (to Billy) After the children! Billy moves on.Allison and Dani who run after Binx making tracks out of the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: But, you said we can't leave the cemetery!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Fine, fine! You stay here then! Billy growls. Max splits. Billy runs into a low branch -- knocks his head off -- fumbles around for his noggin. Finds it. Sets it back. Chases on. The kids sprint for the cemetery wall. Billy closes. Suddenly, the witches appear -- hovering right in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Peek-a-boo, we see you! Give me the book! Binx barrels headlong toward the witches.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: This way! With total trust, Dani and Allison run after Binx. Max slows a bit -- skeptical. Mary hovers lowest, hands out, ready to catch Binx. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Here, kitty kitty! Binx leaps, right into Mary's waiting hands! No! He soars over her and disappears into a bramble patch along the wall. Dani and Allison follow him -- sliding under Mary, who's looked after Binx -- into the bushes and vanish as well. Max sees the escape -- runs faster. Suddenly, Sarah is hovering in front of him -- he looks back -- Billy's right’ ontop of him! As Billy.'s bony phalanges reach for him, Max screams, dashes forward, and...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come to momma, you fresh young thing! ... rips a momentous slide under Sarah and vanishes into the bush patch. Billy plows full-body into Sarah, knocking her into a dizzying series of crazy aerial oops. Billy recovers and tears away bushes. He rips at them so hard, his arm comes flying off on the back-rip. He runs to get it, revealing that he's uncovered a large hole in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Damnable child! Damn Thackery Binx! Damn him to the dogs for eternity!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It was your idea to turn him into a cat, Winnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister, puncture thyself and let the air out of thy brain. (to Billy) Down the hole! After them, rotting beast! Bring them to me dead or... "dead"! Billy crawls down the hole. Mary air-tumbles back to her sisters -- she's dizzy and disheveled. Just as she takes a deep breath -- her nose tears her off in some direction. :

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sisters! I have a bearing! This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C) A match striking, then: illumination. Max grabs a . length of rotting cloth and wraps it around an equally rotting length of wood.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: I really scared, Max. I wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It'll be alright, just lemme get this torch lit -- He lights the makeshift torch, revealing they're under- neath the graveyard. Corners of long-buried coffins stick through the dirt. Bits of corpses and skeletons hang down. Dani hides her eyes. Max screams.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's creepy down here!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Excellent hunting ground. Moles * ; and. shrews aplenty.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Moles... Ick.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: It's not like I can roll up toa drive-thru and order a burger, ya know. I got no pockets. Can't carry money. FOOTSTEPS in the muck down the tunnel. Binx perks an ear: .

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Billy. His touch will rot you where you stand. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches fly in formation. Mary leads the way -- her nose pulls her herky-jerky. It yanks her downward toward Salem. It's zero'd in. She rockets toward earth. . ‘ WINIFRED (> . They be a million million lanterns, — not pyres. The world has grown. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i,

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (doplerin' ) I've got them, Winnie! I've got them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary-the-spiraling-meteor crash lands like a model rocket in a front lawn. Winifred and Mary land nearby. ‘They stow their brooms and consider the street in horror:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: My nose never lies! I smell i t "Costumed" tricker treaters everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: . SARAH
dialogues.text: Hob goblins! Hundreds of them!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: There are children here! I swear it!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: But, where?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Everywhere! Ghoulies, ghosties, jawas, run by. Mary shudders:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I wanna go back to hell...

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Quiet. I must think. This is very strange... A group of ghouls ring a doorbell. An adult answers. He drops something in the ghouls' upheld bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches hold their skirts as bags. Winifred figures out the doorbell. Rings it. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: DEVIL
dialogues.text: Welcome to hell! The witches are aghast. Sarah and Mary cringe abjectly. Winifred is skeptical. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sce

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Master...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We beg pardon, we did not know you lived here, master...

dialogues.speaker: DEVIL
dialogues.text: You're the hottest hags r ve seen all night!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH/MARY
dialogues.text: Oh, master, you are too kind. You're not. bad yerself, sire! They giggle. Winifred silences them with a sharp eye. Tweaks it. The Devil

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: We seek three children and a cat.

dialogues.speaker: DEVIL
dialogues.text: This'1l hold ya till you find ‘em. Some for you... (for Sarah) One for you. Some for you. Love your .schnoz.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A gift... Willst master come sport with us?

dialogues.speaker: DEVIL
dialogues.text: Later when the Mrs. is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Master has taken a wife?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still fool around. wags his tongue at them and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Thank below, master is his old self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riches! Winifred and Sarah consider Mary's discovery. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: c

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Look! 'Tis the candy-covered finger of a man named Clark! Mary inhales the petite-fors. Expecting flesh, she gags.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: 'Tis but caramel!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why would master give us candy? Winifred clues in. A little zombie approaches. She whips the kid's mask off.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Because he is not our master. And these are not hob goblins!

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE KID
dialogues.text: Hey, butthead, lay off my latex!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A child! I knew it! Sarah tries to grab the morsel. The Kid blindsides her with his candy sack. Splits.

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE KID
dialogues.text: Freaks. Winifred hauls her sisters by the ears as she floats to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: All Hallows Eve has become a night of frolic when everyone wears costumes and runs amuck! See them collecting candies 'n' treats? See how many children now in Salem Village? Sisters, we must brew up some spells at once!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH/MARY
dialogues.text: But your spellbook, Winnie, T thought.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: -- Yes, yes, we need the book. But this is too much to pass by. We can kill two crows with a single stone this night! Don't ye see?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: C) No. SARAH/MARY Winifred draws them painfully across the street to the brooms. They mount up.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: You will, sisters. You will. The book will wait while we gather children. If it's. candy they desire, then candy we will give them freely. Winifred gets an itch. More wax.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Time grows short. I fear the worst. Lead on, sister Sarah, quickly, to the sweets! The witches take to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Binx and the kids crawl through an offshoot pipe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ww

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... emerging here, in Binx's 300-year-old subterranean home. Fascinating. Everything's cat-scale. The joint's self-contained and harbors the treasures of three centuries. Thousands of books, home entertainment... : The kids are in awe. Binx goes to the kitty kitchen. | Retrieves a can of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: | You live here?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Be it ever so humble.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: But, how'd you get all this stuff down here?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: : Couple Brit friends of mine helped, Eddy and Winston, bulldogs. Work . like animals. Co) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BINX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nudges can 'n' opener to Dani) Would you mind? I can do it, but it'll take an hour. That's what I miss the most, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Thumbs .~ Dani opens the can. Binx. munches.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Lemme just refuel and we're outta here. : The kids watch Binx eat with a spoon. He looks up slowly:

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DANI/ALLISON/MAXK
dialogues.text: Sorry, sorry, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I got it! They want the book, right? So -- Max drops the book on the floor. Lights a match. Binx disinterestedly hops up on his "little tykes" barcalounger.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: -- we just torch it! All watch as Max lays the flame to the book. The book blows the flame out with dust 'twixt its pages.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: 'Tis protected by magic. The book cannot be destroyed. Allison scoffs at Max's attempt. Max grows frustrated:

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You coulda just told me that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: No substitute for experience, junior. (beat) Hey, kid... I'm sorry. It's just that I've been around the world more times than I can remember, always a year a time, always making sure I was back here every Halloween to prevent all this, ya know? So naturally you sort of put a bug in my biscuit, ya know? I just didn't want to see what happened to Emily occur again.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Who was Emily? BINX . My little sister. After I disappeared, she was never the same. (pause) She died a year later. The .kids .are struck silent.

dialogues.speaker: DANI -
dialogues.text: We can't never really let 'em get the spellbook then, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: We need help. Who do you trust most in the world to believe you?

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: My dad. A CLAMORING ECHOES in the entrance tunnel to Binx's home.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: It's Billy the Bonesman. Come on, we gotta move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... blasts out of the sky... rockets across the parking lot... into the store at Mach-1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -. Slaloms late night shoppers... aisles of foods, and ... finally comes to a broom bending halt at a Halloween candy display: NEW! & IMPROVED! "Little Candy Voodoo Crows!" Relieved, Mary lets her broom handle go. SNAP! It slaps the "keystone" box. The whole display tumbles.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (mouthful) Thweets.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Quickly! The witches stack their broom bristles with boxes. They speed out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +s. take to the sky once more... and zip like comets through a 3-story French Crueller on a donut shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightowl teenaged Halloweeners tappin' keggers in their mini-trucks. .A.manhole is pushed open by Max. Binx springs out -- immediately caught in a set of headlights.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Ut oh. Max ducks. A loud CARN HORN doplers by overhead. THUP!- THUP! DOOF! UGH! and a SQEALING YELP. Then, silence. Max, Dani and Allison climb out -- stand looking down with sad dened faces (We don’t see Bing). Dani cries. Allison's hand jumps to her mouth. Max's eyes widen. POP! -- a stuck.plunger pulled off smooth glass. Allison' chand..comes down. Dani stops crying. Max's eyes widen ev more. Then, THOWOOPOOF! Binx springs to his feet. Shakes his little head like a cartoon character after a good ste rolling:

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: I hate it when that happens.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: But -- but -- but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That car just totally flattened you!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: It hurt too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Improbable, not impossible. Binx leaps atop a newspaper rack. The kids keep their. spooked distance. Binx explain under the glow of a street amp:

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: When the witches curse'd me they gave me nine million lives. It wasn't until after the first fifty when my family all passed on that I realized what the wretched sisters had really done... I cannot die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy the Butcher's fingers lift the manhole cover. A COP'’S BIKE ROARS over it. Billy's fingers snip off and tumble away. The zombie moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are making their way towards the waterfront.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Okay... alright, let's get moving, we can't stand in one place like this -- Billy the Butcher's approaching slowly, with those long, scary, dead-guy, wobbly strides.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: This is all your fault!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What?! Don't blame me for everything?! I didn't make that guy rise from the dead!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Um, kids...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: No, but you brought the witches back and they did, so you're responsible! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: But it was your idea to go up to their house in the first place!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: "Scuse me, guys...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: God, you're immature! I didn't tell you to light the candle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Ah, boys and girls! We're up to out necks in...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It was just a dare, you didn't have to do it! If I dared you to jump off a bridge, would you?!

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: If you dared me... Yeah, I would.

dialogues.speaker: BINX/ ALLISON
dialogues.text: You would?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: You're crazy!

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: You're impossible!

dialogues.speaker: , BINX
dialogues.text: Ah... true love. Binx looks back -- Billy cometh. Checks the area. They're stuck. Billy is about to grab the kids... when BAM! a telephone pole erupts from a corner and blindsides Billy, knocking him into the ocean. Alan and Ben appear, shouldering a big wooden cross. They're wolving candy.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Ben! Alan!

dialogues.speaker: BEN/ ALAN
dialogues.text: Maxwell. Maximillian. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Thanks, man, we were dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: BEN/ ALAN
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about, man?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: For knockin' that zombie out with, what is this anyway, this cross?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The ultimate fetish. The night grew dark. We grew scared. We built a cross. The most powerful talisman, renders all demons powerless. Heavy though. You want it?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: You gotta get some of this crow candy! I can't believe how good this is! Binx's ear perks to this. He's suddenly extremely suspicious:

dialogues.speaker: I BINX
dialogues.text: Where did you get these sweets?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: _ Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Some hags are giving it out at the Haunted House extravaganza.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: They're given out it free. (to Alan) I'm out, let's go get more.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Lead on, Dartanian! Alan and Ben turn to leave, draggin’ their cross. They halt.. Turn back.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN/BEN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... They look 'twixt Max and Allison. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OC
dialogues.text: _ We hallucinate. (shocked at their mind-meld) Jinx. (shocked more) BINX i Oh no... I hope this isn't what ' I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT ‘ The gang meets Binx, crouched low, looking down at the old warehouse converted for the night.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Keep your tails down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, the Sanderson Sisters are handing out candy to the hundreds of kids in line at the Haunted House. The kids run ‘round and get back in line for more. Two LITTLE KIDS come up the hill suckin' dah crows.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: I'm out, gimme another. qd Binx springs onto the Kid's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Hi. Drop it, kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids drop their candy and run off in terror:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabid cat! Rabid cat! Max picks up the candy and studies it. It's a crow shaped every- lasting-gob-stopper.

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: A crow?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's a ‘Little Candy VYoo-doo Crow,' they're a big deal this season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Lemme see.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's just cand:

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: -- It's a bewitchment! A crow does evil's bidding. The witches enchant the sweet, give it to a child, the child sleeps and on the morn, he is gone. Never to be seen again.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Well, where do they go?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: To the witches where they perform some heinous curse! Binx scans the many kids taking candy. to him. His eyes narrow. His ears are rigid cones.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Dani! She's eaten the candy!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Dani, no! Spit it out!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Just say no, Dani! Max grabs her and gives her a jolt to the back with his palm. Instead of spitting it out, she swallows it!

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Ut oh.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I in't ke | it i out!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: You have sealed her fate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What?! What?! What did Ido?! But, Binx is already racing down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: We_must stop them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the set-up, Binx just comes flying out of the shadows and lands square on Winifred's face. He goes to town, attacking like a rabid animal. Winifred reels. Halloweeners spread out and watch! They think it's part of the Haunted House act! Max, Allison and Dani collect the scattering candies. Stuffing them in Dani's candy bag. ‘MAX (to Kids) Gimme all the crows! They're poison! Some of the kids. obey, others scramble off -- fervently suckin’ on the candies. Sarah and Mary grab Dani.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (big sniff) Sweet, like fresh meat!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Guess who's coming to dinner?! ... WHOMP! Allison crowns Sarah with a smilin' jack-o- lantern bucket. Candy corn EXPLODES like a dynamited pinata! Sarah and Mary flail forward. Their sharp teeth pierce the corrugated metal siding of the warehouse. Sparks fly as dentin meet aluminum. They're stunned and stuck. Allison hands the bucket back to the KID she took it from.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Cool. This is way better than last year! Winifred flings Binx at the wall. He bounces off, hits the ground, rolls and springs to his feet once more. Winifred's a gruesome sight. But, the audience of Kids love it -- they applaud! She changes as did Sarah -- a hellhag! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: You'll die 8 million times; each the worse than last; little kitty -- with fire blast! Winifred hurls a palm-flame at Binx and sets him afire. Binx SCREECHES! Max grabs dunks him in a "Bobbin'-for- apples" tub -- putting him out. He sizzles.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: We can't hold ‘em, let's get out of here! Allison grabs Dani. The kids split. The haunted house audience applauds. WINIFRED . Get up you fools! After them! To the brooms! Sarah and Mary rouse themselves. They're "normal" selves again -- dopey. The brooms fly over. The witches mount- up. Winifred considers all the children still munching the little candy voo-doo crows:

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (sweet as pie) See you all real soon, kids! BR-ZOOM! They're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang slows to a walk, Binx stops.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: When I saw all those kids, all those innocent kids eating the crows... I thought about... I just saw my little Emily in all their faces. Binx wipes at his eyes with his paw.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: They have bewitched the children of Salem and now they mean to take their lives.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: They're gonna kill all the kids in town?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Yes. The bewitchments bring the children to them, once there, with the spellbook, the witches conjure a potion to drain children's lives.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do? Just hide the book from them, like forever?!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: No. With the bewitchments given out, I would say they mean to take it back tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: I don't feel good, Max.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: The enchantment has begun. To your parents, ! The kids start through the woods. A moment later, overhead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. the witches fly slowly, scanning the treetops.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I see no children, only birdies and squirrels! That reminds me, Winnie, I'm hungry! Winifred smacks her. Mary spins ‘round and ‘round in the air, clutching her Electrolux hose.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: My nose does not lie! They are down there, I can smell them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town's annual Halloween party is in progress. The place is packed. Adults in elaborate costume hang outside smoking cigarettes and drinking beers. Max, Allison, Dani, and Binx approach at a jog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, Allison, Dani, and Binx stand taking in the noisy, crowded room which is filled with adults dressed in bizarre costumes. An Elvis zombie dances with a two hundred pound geisha. CHRIS ISAK is playing on the SOUND SYSTEM. This is the one night of the year when the adult population of Salem gets to act out their wildest fantasies, and they make the most of it.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: And I thought cats were weird.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: They're around here somewhere. Let's split up and find them. Max and Allison go one way. Dani and Binx another.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX AND ALLISON
dialogues.text: moving through the crowd. Suddenly, a pair of white hands clamp around Max's neck. Max and Allison jump. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal a white-faced vampire, in fact, Max's dad, costumed as Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (speaking in an over-baked Lugosi accent) I am not dad. I am Dad-Cula! (sees Allison) And who is this charming young blood donor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad -- Allison -- Allison -- Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (kisses her hand) Ummm. Type 0, my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Dad, something terrible has happened.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (instantly) Your sister! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: She's fine!... Dad, I know I'm an incredible wise-ass, but I really need you to trust me on this one.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: ON DANI AND BINX
dialogues.text: moving through the crowd with Binx in her arms. She hears somebody call her name, looks. up and sees a heavily-made-up woman wearing an absurdly tight dress, a frightful looking blonde wig, and bright red lipstick. A huge crucifix dangles between two homemade, very pointy, pink cellophane breast projections. Dani is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: What are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Madonna. Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches, following Mary's nose, approach through the parking lot. The folks outside pay little attention to them, taking them for fellow. partiers.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: The Sanderson sisters?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (as Dad-cula) I see.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You've got to believe me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Co

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I believe you, Max. (as Dad-cula) But why is your nose getting longer?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: How much candy have you had, honey?

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: I haven't 0.D.ed! This is really happening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you -- I believe you. |

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: No she doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DANT
dialogues.text: (indignantly) I'm talking to the cat.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: (sees something) Uh-oh. The girls are here. Dani looks up and sees... The witches entering the hall.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Let's share this with your father.
But when she looks back, Dani is gone.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Dani? The witches split up and move through the crowd, looking for the kids. A middle-aged woman, costumed as GLINDA from The Wizard Of 0z approaches Sarah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Are you a good witch, or a bad witch? Mary glowers at her for a beat, then lets out with the biggest, juiciest, smelliest fart in movie history. Miss America, standing directly behind her, passes out, while an Indian chief and Fidel Castro scurry for air space.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Does that answer your question?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's.the- truth, Mr. Dennison!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We swear it, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Swear to God. ON DAVE © starting to believe them. 1 The MAYOR, dressed as Long John Silver, steps up to the microphone on the podium. A line of contestants in elaborate costumes stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Har har! Shiver me timbers! It be time for our annual costume contest. Har har! Dani moves through the crowd, looking for Max.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) Max... Max...

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Har! Our contestants be right here behind me. Yer applause will determine our winner. Dani looks up and sees that... Winifred has spotted her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So without further ado... Let's hear it for... Saddam Hussein! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the audience applauds mildly, Winifred gives a sharp whistle. Sarah and Mary spot Dani.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The Hunchback of Notre Dame! As the witches close in on her, Dani backs up toward the podium...

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Julia Child. Dani leaps up onto the stage, and grabs the mike from the ‘Mayor. Max! They're here! The crowd gets quiet, as they turn their attention to Dani.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Max and Allison push their way up to the stage, leaving Dave very bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Max, what the heck is...? Max takes the microphone from Dani.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, this is an emergency! The crowd becomes hushed and very concerned.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: The kids in this town are in great danger.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: The Sanderson sisters have returned from the grave!

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: And_there they are! She points to the sisters, who are closing in on the stage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The audience, still not sure what's going on, turns their gaze on the Sandersons, who, assuming they're caught, bare their teeth and hold out their talons, threatening the crowd like cornered rats. They are very scary, and the crowd instinctively pulls back. But when Winifred starts CRACKLING with ELECTRICITY, the crowd, taking this for a spectacular Halloween put-on “eooohs" and applauds appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: as he relaxes, laughs, and starts applauding.

dialogues.speaker: ON KIDS
dialogues.text: realizing no one believes them. Winifred looks at the stage. But the kids and Binx are gone. She snarls with frustration -- But suddenly, with a ferocious roar, Billy rushes up onto the stage. There i a beat as the audience stares at him. The Mayor puts his hand over Billy's head, and the audience gives him a thunderous round of applause.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: That's first place, son! The Mayor claps Billy on the back... And both his arms fall off.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE'S SHOCKED REACTION
dialogues.text: .. And then they applaud even harder.

dialogues.speaker: ON DAVE AND JENNY
dialogues.text: applauding proudly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (nearly in tears) Do we have a couple of creative kids, or what? Gosh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Max and Allison as they run for it. Dani has fallen behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches mount up.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Our time grows short. Hurry, Sister Sarah, sniff them out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids rush back through town. Binx pads along a brick wall -- head height with the gang.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: So much for the townspeople. I think it's safe to say we're now officially on our own. “MAK We gotta just destroy this thing!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's indestructible. Don't you ever listen?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then what are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Destroy the witches. The kids look to one another. They're scared.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: How do you destroy a witch?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: You drive a wooden stake through its heart, of course.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Gross.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: No disrespect, but this is reality! If it was that easy everybody'd do it. There are only two ways, hang them or burn them.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: How're we supposed to get nooses around their necks?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Unlikely. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then we have to burn them?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: And the flames must be as hot as the fires of hell.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: They'll find us wherever we go, right? (pause) Then I know where to lead them. Allison, take Dani home. Binx and I will take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Don't be so macho!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: (same time) We're in this together!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: One thing I learned as a cat, when it comes to a fight, you want the females on your side.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay. We're a posse. They share a group hug.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVE-IN MOVIE THEATER
dialogues.text: playing Night Of The Living Dead! The dead are overtaking the town. The sisters fly close to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: An encouragement, sisters. Our brethren are prepare'd the way for us even as we speak! (meaning the hundreds of moviegoers) And they are defenseless! See, they merely sit and watch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids run AWAY FROM the CAMERA WHICH PULLS UP to reveal that this is the high school athletic field. The school looms in the distance. The kids are running towards it.  es

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's put his arms back on, right to left and back to front. He's at a "DON'T WALK" signal. He just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches follow the kids' scent across the field towar the school, which looks ominous in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (frightened) What is this place? It stinks of «+. children. Mary points to several outdoor basketball hoops, looming up in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are those?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Gallows. Sarah and Mary gulp and rub their necks. They are scared.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: This is a prison for children.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You're right, Winnie. Sarah follow the scent to a window, which has been smashe and opened. :

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: This is where they entered.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (scared) I'll wait here. Winifred and Mary share a look, then grab Sarah and shove her, shrieking, in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches creep cautiously past lines of lockers.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Opens a locker.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: 'Tis for the little ones. They hang them off these hooks, then close the door. These vents let them breathe. Sarah and Mary cackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches and Billy move past the school's indoor pool.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: 'Tis a drowning pool. (points to diving board) The victim is forced to walk that plank, then they shove him in! Sarah cackles. Mary sticks her finger in the water and tastes it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The water has been poisoned. Sarah titters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches move past the weights and exercise equipment.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: This must be the torture chamber!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (points to bench) See, the victim is strapped to this bench... (points to heavy weights) Then these weights are put on his chest, until the bones break! They cackle with delight. Winifred suddenly grabs them both by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Dawdling idiots! We must find my book before the sun comes up... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Binx, crouched just outside the door to the gym, listening in on the witches.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: 1 Binx finds this piece of information curious.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (furious)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (terrified of her) Oh yes, Winnie, and you've explained it so succinctly.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Explained what? Winifred jolts them. But a voice suddenly says.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Meow there. Binx is sitting in the door to the gym, blinking at them languidly.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Are you bow-wows up for a little chase?

dialogues.speaker: , WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Get him! Binx scats as the witches mount their brooms and go flying after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the witches come flying out into the corridor. But Bin is nowhere to be seen. The green school corridors stretch out in several directions. The witches are baffled.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Where did he go? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who? Bop!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (sniffs) That way. Her nose points into the ceramic shop.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They be in here. The kids' (and Binx's) voices come out of the brick room. The witches rush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... inside and spring upon the kids.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Now we have you! Oops. The voices come from a Walkman. The source of Mary's smellment is a sock from each of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: BINK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (from recorder) But seriously, girls, if you haven't realized by now, I'd just like to say, things are about to heat up around here! Just as they realize they've been tricked... Binx and Max appear in the doorway outside:

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (clutching the spellbook) Looking for this?! Binx leans against the kiln door. It slams shut just as the witches rush for it. They press they faces up against the inside of the portal.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: You_wil] die 8 million wavs, cat You_will rue the day! Wretched Snotlings, woe will you rue the day! Binx swats the "IGNITE!" button. WHOOOOOSH! An ocean of flame fills the kiln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: () They pull up and stop, seeing smoke rising from the ki } chimney. Binx hangs his head... 300 years of weighty purpose lifts from his shoulders. His eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Binx, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. I'm good. It's just -- it's finally over. Binx sees the chimney smoke forming 3 sinister shapes.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Binx?! What's happening?! We just cremated them!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: I should have guessed! I should have known! J should have known!

dialogues.speaker: DANI/MAX/ALLISON
dialogues.text: Known what?!

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: Tc They cannot die.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: They can't die, because they're not alive! They're in transient form on All Hallows Eve. Not alive, not dead. Spirit only! Winifred's curse said they'd come back when a virgin lit the Black Flame Candle. You did. Back they came. For this night only. They seek the book to conjure a potion of life.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What happens if they don't get the book?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: By the morn they perish... forever. So said Winifred Sanderson. But we cannot destroy them. C) The witches have reformed fully now. They plummet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3g

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then we gotta hide!

dialogues.speaker: BINK
dialogues.text: There is no place where Sarah's nose will not follow.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then we gotta throw her off the scent till dawn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's still here. "WALK!" Billy strides into the . street. "DON'T WALK" flashes. Billy stops in the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: I'm getting sleepy, Max.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Just stay awake for a little while, Dani, we're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Where are you taking us?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You don't wanna know, oh no.

dialogues.speaker: JAY AND ERNIE
dialogues.text: are shave creaming a car. They step in front of Max.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Ain't it past your bedtime?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You're a real witty guy, Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Hey, buttsweep, read my head! My name is Ice! Gimme candy. Max gives him Dani's bag. Dani's horrified.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Max, are these the morons that stole your shoes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ice, ya know, those cross trainers look a lot better with this jacket. Trade me and I'll throw in my Red Socks cap, my wayfarers, and this one sock I got left.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Max, what are you doing? Initially surprised, Allison smiles and nudges her.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Throw in the babe, and I'll think about it. Jack cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I'll give you each a hug.

dialogues.speaker: JAY /ERNIE
dialogues.text: 1 (instantly) Deal! Max switches with Ernie. Allison gives Jay a hug and rubs all over him.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Yoouuh! Babe, do it! Ernie shoves him away. Allison hugs him real quick. Binx rubs Ernie's leg. Dani shakes hands with them.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you both. The kids continue down the street.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Where are we going now?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: My favorite restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: SIGN
dialogues.text: that reads “PARKING FOR CAP'N CRABB'S SEAFOOD PALACE ONLY All others will be towed. This means you, Sailor!" The kids, led by Binx, come INTO VIEW and approach a larg green dumpster in a corner right behind the restaurant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fish tails, heads, and bones litter the ground around it. Binx laps his chops. Dani holds her nose.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Deee-lish!

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Pee-yew! Two alley cats leap up out of the .dumpster.. They sit on its rim and lick their paws clean. They've just had a good meal.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: These are my friends, Half Tail and Love Bite. (confidentially) , Love Bite and I used to have this thing but some French Tom wooed her... ya know the old story. (leaps on the dumpster) Last one in is a smelly dog.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Do we have to?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Think of it as a seafood jacuzzi. Binx plunges in, and the kids follow. CAMERA HOLDS ON the dumpster as the kids AD-LIB grossed out reactions.

dialogues.speaker: BINX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ummm. The scrod is fabulous. Love Bite, still | licking her paws, hears something and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the shadows of the witches and Billy can be seen approach ing, and the murmur of their voices is heard. Love Bite meows a warning.

dialogues.speaker: BINX, (0.8)
dialogues.text: The witches! Inside the dumpster the kids can be heard scurrying aroun as the witches, following Mary's nose, come skulking INTO VIEW. She follows the scent of the children right up to the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking straight down into the dumpster, which is filled with fish parts, napkins, lobster claws. (The kids have completely buried themselves in the goop).

dialogues.speaker: ON MARY
dialogues.text: as she reaches into the dumpster and comes up with... A fish head, which she nibbles on.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I've lost them.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
