dialogues.text: (whacking fish head out of her hands) Idiot! But then she sees Love Bite and turns instantly charming.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Hello, puss puss. Love Bite just blinks at her.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Tell me, my pretty, would you like... Winifred puts her hand in her magic sack, and pulls out.. a living mouse.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: A nice mouse. She dangles it by its tail in front of Love Bite, who licks her chops. Mary would like to eat it herself. And Sarah eyes it greedily; she'd like to pull its legs off.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Have you seen three children and a black cat? Love Bite MEOWS in the affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Where did they go? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne”

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Love Bite points her tail in the direction the witches came from. Returning to her old evil self, Winifred hisses at Love Bite, frightening her, then drops the mouse, which Mary and Sarah both dive for.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH/MARY
dialogues.text: (AD-LIB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine... It's mine! They bash together, and the mouse escapes under the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Imbeciles! The children have doubled back! After them! The witches jump on their brooms and fly off. A moment later the kids' fish covered heads peer over the rim of the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: BINX AND LOVE BITE
dialogues.text: rubbing against each other affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Thanks, L.B. The kids climb out of the dumpster and stand picking fish bones off themselves. Dani is whiny, really miser- able, a seven-year-old who needs to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It worked.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: We need a place to hide until the sun comes up.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: (miserable, whiny) Can't we just go home?

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yes. That's exactly where we are going. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dL

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? But what will you tell your parents?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The usual. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: of the Dennison home lit by the moon, as the kids and Binx run down street towards it. CAMERA PANS UP TO the full moon... then PANS DOWN TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Ernie are walking down a moonlit path, eating candy from Dani's bag.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Wanna smash some pumpkins?

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Wanna look in windows, watch babes undress?

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Well you make a suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: I don't feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: You ate too much candy, you oinker. Suddenly, they look up and see... Winifred, Sarah, and Mary, straddling their brooms, standing in front of them, blocking their path.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Whoa, those are the three ugliest babes I have ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: If they were any uglier, I'd need an eyeball transplant. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jay and Ernie crack up. The witches just stare at them.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Naughty boys taste the best.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hear that? (sarcastically) I guess these are like... real witches.

dialogues.speaker: JAY/ERNIE
dialogues.text: Whoa! Jay and Ernie both make a cross with their forefingers an hold it up in front of themselves. They crack'up at their own hilariousness.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Out of the way, bags. As one, Winifred, Mary and Sarah lift six feet off the ground and just hover there, staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAY AND ERNIE'S REACTION
dialogues.text: as their jaws drop in unison. They share a take, then turn and bolt...

dialogues.speaker: FULL MOON
dialogues.text: as the shrieking witches fly across the moon with Jay and Ernie dangling from the broomsticks, wailing.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Mommy! CAMERA PANS DIRECTLY DOWN TO the Dennison house.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Max and Allison close and lock windows... Dani takes a container of milk out of the fridge and fills a bowl for Binx... Max closes his basement window, pulls the shade shut... Allison seals the cracks with wet paper towels... Max selects his favorite baseball bat as a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dani is asleep. Binx is lapping milk from a bowl. Allison sits staring at Max's room. Max sits staring at Allison. Max leans

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Now all we have to do is lay low until the sun comes up.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: You know, Max, you're okay, for a dog person.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Hey, give me some face. in and Binx playfully swats him with his paw.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Sucker.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I hate cats.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. (yawns ) That moo juice hit the spot... Mind if I catch ten on your pillow?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Go for it: Binx crawls up next to Dani. Binx kneads his paws, then curls up on the pillow. Max pets him.

dialogues.speaker: . BINX
dialogues.text: Oh man, you guys are gonna turn me into one of those fat stupid contented cats... Have to change my name to Muffy, or Fluffy. BINX PURRS loudly.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a personal question?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Sure, kid. MAX “ How many have you used up so far? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: . . BINX
dialogues.text: What, lives, you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Including the Buick back there, and the fire thing, 321. That's all?

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Even if you try, there's only so many ways to go? Sure would like to, though. See my family again... see Emily... Just sleep... forever... Max stares at the cat. Binx falls fast asleep and only his PURRING resonates in the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: (awkwardly ) Nice room. They stare at each other... alone for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Max? You up there? The moment shattered, Max moves to the heating duct grate

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where's Dani?
Down here. She's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, good. Thanks for taking her out, son. I know you didn't want to, but you did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No problem, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And hey, that new girl friend of yours? Hubba-hubba. Way to go. "Night.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Max whips a look over to Allison. She's heard it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Do you smell fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches are circling. Sarah's nose is plumb tuckered.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Find them! Find them!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I've lost them! The scent is vanished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘Allison stares forlornly at Binx. Max's eyes divide thei time twixt Binx and Allison.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: He must be so lonely. I wish we could help hin.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I'll keep him when this is over.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: For one lifetime. Max falls asleep. Allison's eyes drift to the spellbook on the floor. After a considerable amount of indecision, she opens it. Max stirs. Binx rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: There must be a spell to turn Binx back into a human. Open. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The spellbook opens. Pages riffle. The words are in flux. ALLISON © That's why they need the book. The spells change... The words come together. Allison's hair streams upward -- as if some invisible hairdryer were upturned ‘neath her. She is clueless to this. An orange flame'd force rises from the book... collects around the ceiling search ing for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: A Spell for Spreading the Black Death. A Spell for Controlling of minds. A Spell for Pestilence. Demonic Possession. Raising an Army of the Dead to do Thine Bidding. The flame-force streams into a heater duct.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: A Spell of Protection, ‘When malice is fear'd, a circle of salt protects all who stand inside it from all flesh, living and dead..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the witches see across Salem City, a homing beckon! ‘ WINIFRED

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KIDS
dialogues.text: as Allison turns the pages. Suddenly, there is a YOWL, and a black paw slams the book shut. Binx leaps upon the closed book, keeping it shut.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: as the orange and black flame suddenly goes out.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BINX
dialogues.text: standing on the book. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: I can't even take a cat nap around here!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: We were just trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: . BINX
dialogues.text: Well, you've sealed our fate now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is asleep. Dave snuggles against her.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Not now, honey.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (still Dad-Cula) One little bite is all I ask. CAMERA PANS OFF them TO the window, which is open...

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You have to go to work tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Work? In the daylight? Don't be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: land gently. A bony finger pokes through the screen in the window, and slowly, silently tears it open. INT. ‘DAVE AND JENNY'S ROOM (Through the following in the b.g., the witches are seen sneaking like mice into the room through the torn screen. Dave is kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Please let me go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (singing in Lugosi voice) Like a virgin, bitten for the very first time...

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Dave -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: With a blood type, close to mine... Think of the child we could make. Little... Madonnacula! Jenny giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Binx looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: The Sanderson Sisters...

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Great, now whadda we do?!.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: We make a stand here, till dawn.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Then we need salt.

dialogues.speaker: BINX/MAX
dialogues.text: Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the door to the attic as it opens, and Max (arme with his baseball bat) and Allison step out. Suddenly, she clutches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hairs on the back of my neck are going crazy. They pass Mom and Dad's closed door and disappear in kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches hide at the foot of Dave and Jenny's bed.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: gazing out at the full moon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ms

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Spirits of the moonlit sky, make them sleep, until they die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes a box of salt from the shelf. Allison is still very nervous and scared.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (reads from box, kidding) It says right here, 'Form a circle to protect from zombies, witches, and tele-marketing surveys.' we (a beat) Sorry, I'm cracking dumb jokes again.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: (very scared) Hey, keep 'em comin'.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I dunno. Max takes Allison in his arms and holds her. Allison is ‘reassured; this is not the little boy she was with earli in the evening.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Come on. He takes her by the hand and leads her up the stairs to the attic. °

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Allison enter.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Max! The spellbook's gone! He goes to the bed to wake Dani.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Dani? Dani, wake up -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pulls the covers back and Winifred's there.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Trick or treat! The closet door blasts open. Mary comes out clutching the spellbook.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Looking for this?! Sarah comes out behind her with a bewitched Dani by the arm and holding a squirming sack -- Binx is in it.

dialogues.speaker: ' ALLISON
dialogues.text: Max charges Winifred with the bat. She opens the spellbook. Unseen force erupts from it -- it knocks Max out cold. Allison straddles his unconscious form. Spins ‘round, ensconcing them in a protective circle of salt. Salt splashes Mary's outstretched hand -- it sizzles and urns.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Been reading I see... How clever. But it will not save your little friends! She whistles. The brooms soar in. The witches whisk off CACKLING damnably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches land too fast.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Get them prepar'd. We're having guests for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We are?

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: (belts Sarah) The children are coming, idiot! Winifred opens the spellbook, lights the black flame candle and holds out her little sack:

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Evil'd things that peck and fly. The hour has come to fill the sky! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Co

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She opens her sack -- hundreds, thousands! of spectral "Little Candy Voo-Doo Crows" fly out. alive. The crows are whisked along in the rivers of conjur'd smoke from the black flame candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke streams carry the crows into homes (including Alan & Ben's). The crows flutter above the children's beds. The children stir in their sleep, but do not wake.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Little ones, asleep so sweet, I have more for thee to eat. The children lick their lips in their sleep. The crows i : Without waking, the children i leave their rooms.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (comes ' round) Where's Dani?!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: They took her.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I gotta get my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Jenny are there ghostly white... like corpses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Mom! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: This isn't sleep, Max. They're cursed. Look. The window with the screen ripped out. The kids walk to the window. In the street, walking like little pajama-zombies are the sleepwalking children of Salem.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: They're summoning the kids... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Co

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: They've gotta be going to the Sanderson house. We gotta stop ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Allison grab kids and shake them:

dialogues.speaker: MAX/ALLISON
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up! It's a trap! Stop! The kids reel and spin and continue on.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX ,
dialogues.text: Don't ask me, I can't make the sun rise!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Yes you can... come on. Can you drive??

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Allison get in the family's station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CAR
dialogues.text: Max sits behind the wheel. Allison is in the passenger seat. Max turns the ignition key, but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It won't start!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Put it in neutral.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Right. He does, and this time it STARTS UP perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Lights. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Max looks around for them. She reaches over, turns them on.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: We're a good team.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Buckle up. They buckle their seat belts. Max puts the car in reverse. It bucks.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Parking brake.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Right. He releases it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Binx is still in the sack, hung off a utensil hook. The witches conjure. The cauldron is once again aboil. Sarah stirs. Winifred consults the spellbook and adds ingredients. Mary takes testing pokes at Jay and Ernie who're suspended in a cage.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Ye need fattening. Eat! Wrappers et al, they wolf candies. Dani is strapped to the chair near the cauldron exactly as was Emily Binx.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Soup's on. Prepare her. Sarah and Mary fit the funnel over Dani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max cuts a wild swath across forest and asphalt. Be- witched children march up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's eyes are Frisbees!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Max, watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy sees the impending doom:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Billy's a bug on the windshield. Max hits the | wipers. SLAP-SLAP! Billy's face goes left/right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cauldron BUBBLES and SPLATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: 'Tis ready. Winifred ladles up a spoon of the glop and steps toward Dani. Bypasses her and moves toward...

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: You for dessert. ++. Jay and Ernie. Sticks the ladle in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Drink.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (beyond bewitchment) I cannnnnn't, I'll like blow chunnnnonks...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: This will perk your appetite! Mary takes a red-hot poker out of the fire and starts moving it toward the boys' feet. Jay's empty eyes register this -- opens his mouth. Winifred spills a single drop into his mouth. Then Ernie. They instantly start to glow. The Sanderson sisters gather ‘round -- in awe.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: The light of life. The witches purse their gruesome lips and inhale. Streams of the light course into their mouths. The light and life drains from Jay and Ernie. They age, and age, and age... 90 years each. The witches get younger. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: m (geezer) Bummmmmeerrrrr.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: It works! I have stolen their life! Their years are mine! Winifred points out the window, where children can be seen sleepwalking toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Look! The children are coming! We will give them the potion and suck the life from all of them. When the sun comes up, they will all die of old age, but we will live for a thousand years!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: The last great spell will come to pass.. And from the mouths of babes shall we leech the life of > eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7) (the big deal) Immortals... The droplet is just about to fall... when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max slides toward the house. Kills the lights. Billy flails off the hood like a stunt dummy... i INT. ‘SANDERSON HOUSE - NIGHT ... Crashes through the front door -- out cold. The : witches spin to see Max in the darkened doorway. Beyond i him, the children of Salem are almost to the house.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Prepare to die. Again.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: You have no power, you are just a clever little boy.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: O There's a power greater than magic, and that's knowledge. And I know something you don't. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Oh ho ho, and what is that, sprout ling?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Daylight savings time... an almost imperceptible furrow of worry in Winifred's row.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It's complicated, but basically what it means is... the sun comes up earlier than normal. A BIRD is SINGING outside. Out the window, the sun is rising! The witches turn away from the light in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max grabs Binx and Dani. Kicks the cauldron over and grabs the spellbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison’s playing the dimmer switch on the car lights, focused at the house window. A "Nature" soundtrack from the STEREO. The gang splits.

dialogues.speaker: INT SANDERSON HOUSE
dialogues.text: Mary and Sarah are clutching Winifred's legs in terror.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH/MARY
dialogues.text: Please, Winnie, save us! We're too old to die!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Let go, apes! That way is west, the sun riseth in the east! The "sunrise" goes out. Winifred floats quickly to the window.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Damn the boy! He has trick'd us once more! After them! The witches take to the sky. Billy rouses and follows.

dialogues.speaker: ON OLD JAY AND ERNIE
dialogues.text: totally out of it.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hey, man, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: Whoa! These hags are bad news!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time Allison speeds the car down hill. The witches dive bomb it. Mary crash lands on the roof like a 300 pound anvil, denting. the...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: ... inside all the way to the seat backs. Dani screams. Max struggles to maintain control. In the moonlight Dani sees a hundred pajama clad kids, sleepwalking up the hillside. .

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: It's a zombie pajama party... Allison hits the brakes! SCREECH! The car stops on a dime. Mary vaults into the darkness over the hood. Max guns it. Another landing. Mary sticks her head in the window right next to Dani. Dani hits the electric window gad wedges Sarah's nose tightly. Mary can't pull it ree. Binx jumps into Dani's lap.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nice kitty...

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: You wish. Swat! Binx claws the tremendous nose. Mary bellows. Her nose slips free. She flails into the woods. Mary's suddenly in the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Hang on! Allison guns it. BOOM! The car drives over some enormous speed bump. Just as they're all feeling along- side the car (like the famous Wizard Of Oz shot). She launches a flame-ball at the tires. They go flat. The car swerves. Winifred shoots ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison brodies the wagon to a stop. The gang jumps out. Max flies open the hatchback. ne P

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Where are we?!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Near the cemetery, I know 2 short cut, this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Binx, take ‘em there, I'll keep her busy.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON/DANTI
dialogues.text: Max, no!

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Binx, get ‘em outta here!

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: You heard the man. Max lifts his mountain bike outta the trunk. Helmet, Jacket, gloves, goggles. Straps the spellbook to the rack.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I'll meet you there. Go! Binx leads them off. Allison dashes back for a second. She grabs Max and kisses him good.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Wha -- wha -- wha -- what --

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Be careful. .

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (full of it now) Hey! Witch! I got your book! At the end of the road, Winifred cuts a neat Top Gun U-turn ripping back toward the kids -- riding Mary's Electrolux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max tears along narrow trails. Winifred tracks him. Max pumps faster. Winifred comes neck and neck -- swings at him with the vacuum hose -- connects -- Max wobbles, rides.on, ducking tree limbs and jumping logs. Then, suddenly... Max peels off, shoots down a ravine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Winifred follows. Max bunny hops a stream, along the stepping rocks, work- ing his bike like a horse. Winifred jets over it -- SONIC-BOOMING the water! Max hits the other side and climbs toward the forest's crest. Winifred negotiates the trees at 150 mph. She closes the gap. Max rides the ridge. Winifred is a hundred yards back and closing like a bullet. He sees her. He brings his bike to a stop. Guess where?

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF SUICIDE GORGE
dialogues.text: Max's pulse soars. He sweats the decision. His fingers grip the bars. His thighs grip the seat padding. His hand cinches up the pedal straps. Winifred's 50 yards back, she'll be here in seconds. Max flips his mountain light on. It illuminates the killer drop off: sheer and treacherous. Max swallows.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on. Okay. Okay. Okay -- Off he goes! (Ihe Man From Snowy River.) Winifred arrives, pulls 6 1/2 G's in a 90 degree midair turn and rockets down the ravine after Max. Max slides through 60 degree slopes of loose dirt, jumps off rock faces, slots narrow pass-thrus, and hits the hardpack forest ground. He tears like a madman down the hill. Winifred tracks him. Max splits left -- Slaloms the trees. Winifred goes right, joy sticks her vacu-broom like Chuck Yeager. Max breaks through and hits the open slope. At the bottom approaching fast, a mountain of fill dirt piled against a wall. Winifred directs the vacuum thrust backward and overtakes Max. Makes it to the end of the hill and waits there for him, hovering at the top of the dirt rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hits the dirt hill, races up it and jumps over Winifred! He sails through the air, knocking through the pines.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max comes out of the sky. Crash lands in a clearing. Skids up to Binx, Dani and Allison who're standing safe in a circle of salt next to Emily Binx's grave.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (goggles up) Hi, honey, I'm home. The witches buzz the kids in formation. Allison swipes at them with Max's baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: This is hallowed ground! Billy the Butcher appears, runnin' full bore and wobbly at them. The second his foot hits the salten circle... he howls in pain and ignites like a pile of kindling. Hoppin' ‘round, he dissolves from the feet up, until finally he is just. a head, and then... he is a memory.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: It really works! The witches hover overhead. Max unstraps the book and belts it to his back like a fanny pack.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Boy, give me the book and I will give you everything you desire. Power! Wealth! Women!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: He's already got all that!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: . WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Silence, tart! Prepare to die!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But, sister! Flesh cannot harm them in the circle --

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: -- No, ‘tis true, flesh cannot. Winifred and her sister are huddle. Max snaps a big limb off a tree. Max and Allison, back to back. Winifred consults her cribbed spellbook. Lights the black flame candle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: The worms are finished. The maggots done. All that is left, Arise as one! The kids watch the graveyard... skeletons arise.

dialogues.speaker: BINX
dialogues.text: Oh man, where's a dog when you need one.

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Bones, fetch my book! The CLATTERING SKELETONS surround the kids. They blitz! Max swings! Connects! A skeleton blasts into 216 pieces. Another reaches for Allison, she swings! Connects! The skull goes flying. Easy! But they keep coming -- reaching, clutching. Binx pounces a skull. The skeleton reels. Falls against a tombstone. Blows into several sections. One arm clutch-crawls toward Dani. She screams. Binx pounces it. Tosses it. The other grabs him by the tail. Swings him around. Max steps on it and 9-irons the fibula. It ghatters. Binx. goes flying. He scrambles back to the ray. Max and Allison blast skeleton after skeleton into shattering rains of bone fragments. 2?! Well, ' i And not always in the right config. Skulls on arm sockets. Hands to necks, pelvises to clavicles... 1 A set of phalanges grabs Binx's throat. He struggles. Dani tries to pry them off. No good. She does the only thing she can think of, she bites the arm. The SKELETON WAILS! . Binx scrambles up a tree. Max reaches back to swing at the skeletons holding Allison. Another skeleton rips his bat away. The skeleton army thoroughly infiltrates the salten circle. One of them grabs Dani and lifts her high above head. Another secures Max.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Lemme go, bonehead! Winifred and sisters howl in victory. A skeleton takes the spellbook, tosses it up to Winifred. All goes quiet as the CLATTERING OF BONES STOPS. Winifred looks down with evil superiority at Max: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Who will have the last laugh now, little boy? Go to hell!

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: Been there. And I_Jike it. Suddenly, a ROAR from the tree tops. Binx attacks Winifred in a flying whorl of gnashing teeth and claws. Winifred howls. She rips Binx off her face. With an inhuman scream, she hurls him to the ground. Binx hits Emily's gravestone and lies still in a broken heap on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Binx! No! Winifred rifles through the spellbook.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Eat them now, kill them later! Max tears away from his skeleton. Another steps in front and boogies him. Beyond fear Max snatches the skeleton's skull by the eye and nose holes and cracks it off its vertebrate base. The headless body staggers round. Max reaches back for all he's worth. Chucks the skull at ... Winifred. Brains her! The skull shatters! She plummets.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH/MARY
dialogues.text: Winnie! Winniefred hits hallowed ground. A beat. Nothing happens

dialogues.speaker: WINIFRED
dialogues.text: And now you die a hundred thousand horrid deaths at once, ! And I will wallow in each and every one... Winifred takes one step toward Max... somewhere close, a WINDSHIELD "Spiders" into a million tiny fractures. Winifred looks down at her dress, the fabric is turning The affliction runs from her feet up in a rapid crawl. Something sprouts from her back -- she strains her rockening head ‘round to See... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ++. stone wings. Winifred's talony claws clasp together involuntarily. Just before her terrified shrieks fade from her lips and she is lost to stony death altogether.. «+. Max flips her off. Winifred has become a sepulchral angel engraved with this inscription: "Winifred Sanderson. Born 1617... Hanged 1692... Died 1992."

dialogues.speaker: SARAH/ MARY
dialogues.text: them! The skeletons crumble into piles. A11l of them, one by one, disincorporate and stack up. The witches grow fearful. A BIRD SINGS. The sun is xising. Sarah and Mary open their mouths to scream, but they are cut short by the first ray of dawn breaking through the trees. i to dust and are blown away on a passing gentle breeze. Two brooms and the Electrolux drop harmlessly to the ground next to the spellbook, which vaporizes in a dusty cloud. The kids lock down at Binx.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: Binx?... Binx, we did it. They're gone. Binx? Allison lays her hand on the cat.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: He's gone, Max.

dialogues.speaker: , DANI
dialogues.text: (crying) But he can't die!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Right, he can't die, that's what he said... I don't want him to die! Allison comforts Dani. Max runs his hand over Binx's still form.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (teary eyed) Come on, Binx... you got eight million more to go. You said. Come on, don't die. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. The kids look up to see the transparent figure of a boy, floating in the air. Dressed in the same clothes he was. on that fateful night in 1692, he is the spirit of - Thackery Binx who has finally gotten his wish.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Binx?

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Thackery Binx. Hey,. what am I doing down there? My paws... they're hands! He tries to clasp them together but they pass right through one another.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Did you see that?! He's a ghost!

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh! Oh my -- I am, I am a spirit! I can't believe it! 7 1 t I'm dead! The spirit-Binx whisks and jets about the treetops. He soars back and hovers before his friends: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: When the witches were destroyed, so too were all their spells and cruses! (as they're crying) Hey, guys, come on, don't cry for me!

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: But you're dead!

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Well, I've never felt more alive! I'm free! I'm finally free! I can't wait to see my families! (beat) I'll tell them all about you, I promise. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: We're gonna miss you, Binx. Thackery holds still a moment.

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: This is the only hard part about the whole thing... saying good-bye. (pause) I'll miss you all too... very much. I hope you don't think this is too weird to say, but don't feel sad, because someday we'll all see each other again. You can count on it. Thackery floats down to Max. Thackery's smaller.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I can't believe I got all that advice from a guy younger than me.

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Here's one last thing... He that leaveth nothing to chance will do few things ill, but he will do very few things. Live life, Max. Don't be afraid of anything.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Oh, one last thing... love conquers all.

dialogues.speaker: MAK
dialogues.text: I know. Thackery extends his hand. He and Max shake, as best they can.

dialogues.speaker: THACKERY
dialogues.text: Good-bye... The spirit shoots quickly into the morning sky and vanishes FROM VIEW. Dani looks back down and finds... the cat is alive.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Binx?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Guess he still had one left. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: Can you talk? The CAT MEOWS.

dialogues.speaker: DANI
dialogues.text: (hugs him) That's okay. Allison grabs Max and hauls him close.

dialogues.speaker: MAX/ALLISON
dialogues.text: (simultaneous) Thanks for saving my life back there -- (beat, both) Pinch-poke, you owe me -- They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred sleeping kids yawn, rub their eyes, wake up and react to the fact that they don't know where they are or how they got there. Several kids burst into tears. Many more cry, "Mommy!" Alan and Ben seize the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN/BEN
dialogues.text: Everything’ s alright, come on kids, we'll get you home. This way.

dialogues.speaker: INT SANDERSON HOUSE
dialogues.text: Jay and Ernie, their youth restored, hang in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: The last thing I remember is, like, this really big spoon or something. A really ugly babe. And a vacuum cleaner. What's it all mean, man? Ernie suddenly bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: I dunno, I wanna go home, I promise take candy from kids or shave names in my head no more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Ben shepherd the children of Salem down from the hill and back to their homes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They stride slow and dignified, like prophets. Parents rush from homes and hug kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have delivered them unto you from the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's Ben Corwin and Alan Schotznick! Remember the names, Ben Corwin and Alan Schotznick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front page of the Salem Daily Prodigal: a photo of a stone angel. Various headlines read:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT OF THE PAJAMA-ZOMBIES
dialogues.text: Hundreds of Sleeping Kids Gather at Witch House Mysterious Gravestone Appears Traumatized Local Boys Found in Cage Hoax or Hysteria? Parents Baffled

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: It's a cult thing

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: There are no cults in this town. Max, Allison, Binx and Dani lounge watching TV news

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Every station. I can't believe those guys. They're taking credit for everything!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: So what, who's ever going to believe them? Ben and Alan are all over the television:

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Yes, that's true, Ben Corwin and I, did deliver the children of Salem from the clutches of evil.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The stories are true, the Sanderson Sisters did come back from the dead. And we did banish them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Luckily, Salem had Ben Corwin and I, Alan Schotznick, to do battle with the ultimate forces of darkness...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yes, our lives hung in the balance. However, for the children, we carried on valiantly, under powerful fetish protection... For the immediate future, I plan to be on the talk show circuit promoting my new book, Erepare Thyself, The End-is Near, by Alan Schotznick.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I plan to run for office... Binx looks up. He winks. FADE OUT.
